tkatt,"2016-01-29T06:09:31.057Z","A Rally car I can afford","

I love to drive fast on pavement,
column4: a station wagon that is best for getting groceries. With&nbsp
column5: Lego City set 60113 Rally Car I can live my dream of sliding&nbsp
column6: around a muddy race course at high speeds without worrying about my daughter throwing up in the back seat.&nbsp

column1: The box is typical of a small Lego City set. The back has a nice pic over the shoulder of the driver that shows off a nice printed piece that represents the instrument cluster.
104 parts make up this set, 8 extra pieces are included.
column3: There are a few unique printed parts in this set. Four&nbsp
column5: white tiles printed with the word light and pair of eyes&nbsp
column7: displayed on the front of the car, (there is an extra one included). The instrument cluster/dashboard is a 1x2 cheese slope printed with 2 gages, a speedometer&nbsp
column8: and a tachometer. I really like this element and I expect&nbsp
column9: it will show up in many more Lego vehicles.

column4: get three bent skeleton arms and three&nbsp

column2: is printed on the front and back of its torso with an &quot
column4: logo. The head is single sided. No minifig&nbsp

column1: The build is quick. The instructions are easy to follow. There are six stickers to apply.
column3: t usually put all the stickers on sets I build, but the the parts that get stickers in this set are not parts that I can see myself reusing so I put them all on. The stickers&nbsp
column4: add detail to the model and are easy to put on nice and straight. I think it looks good without the stickers as well, so if you hate applying stickers you won&#39
column5: t end up with a plain looking car.

column1: Once I finished the build I was thinking about how I would like to modify it. I don'
column2: t see this as bad thing. I am thinking about buying a second set and swapping parts to build one mostly yellow and one mostly black Rally car. I like the shape and stance of the car, but I&#39
column3: m not sure if I like the rear wing. The car looks good without the wing, so leaving it off is an option.&nbsp
big improvement over the last Rally Car released back in 1987. Although that set had some nice features, like&nbsp
column6: ll need to take the roof off the new model to get the minifig in.

column2: has 104 parts and cost $10 in the U.S. so it hits the $0.10 per part that many people seem to think is a good indicator of a fair&nbsp
column4: t mind paying full price for it and I will surely&nbsp
column5: buy a second set...maybe two more&nbsp
column6: if I see it at a discount.

column3: for Rally Car MOCs and I look forward to building a few more cars&nbsp
column4: based off the instructions but using alternate colors.

column1:
,TRUE,4,3,3,4,4 Schmoobin","2016-03-27T14:35:21.417Z","Ridin' Dirty","

Box/Instructions: The box and the instruction manual are small.
column2: Of course, on the box, there is a picture of the model in action on the front and the play features on the back. &nbsp
column4: s one of those small boxes with the push-thumb tabs. &nbsp
column5: There is not much to say about the instructions.

column1: Parts: though there are a few stickers (which are not a pain to put on thank goodness) there are a total of five
column2: special printed elements, four of which are the same. &nbsp
column3: The pieces that really stood out for me though were the two&nbsp

column2: The set comes with one single minifigure, the racer himself. &nbsp
column3: He has printed sunglasses and a white helmet for protection. &nbsp
column4: The front and back of his torso are printed with racer decals, but the legs are left plain.

column2: This was actually a short, fun build. &nbsp
column3: Building it probably takes around 10-20 minutes tops. &nbsp
column4: There are a couple SNOT techniques used for the front and back bumper/headlights.

column3: The completed model comes with a 3 piece checkered flag. &nbsp
column4: This set is great for younger builders or people who like small LEGO City sets. &nbsp
column5: You can remove the top piece for the minifigure to get in, that means sadly there are no doors. &nbsp
column6: There is much playability in this, for you can race your friends to the finish line!

column1: Overall opinion: I really like the LEGO City sets.
column2: They are cheaper than Licensed Themes (I really enjoy the Star Wars theme) and have a very wide range of sets like LEGO Star Wars. &nbsp
column3: The value for money is great, 10 American dollars for this great set. &nbsp
column4: You should totally get this set for your kid this Easter, it&#39

column1:
,TRUE,4,3,5,4,5 koen_theys","2016-09-13T14:12:39.287Z","Let's rally the team","

Team Airborne Spoilers has gone Rally this time.

column3: s 60027 Monster Truck Transporter, Team Airborne Spoilers is back with a new playing field, Rally!

column1: I got this set for my daughter of 4. In my opinion it is a nice looking small set. We have nothing personal with rally, it just looked a nice and fun set.
Normal LEGO City Box. On the backside there are several images of playability.
There is 1 booklet. The instructions are very simple and the building progress is very basic, about 2 or 3 pieces per built. Ideal for young builders.
1 special part, being the PRINTED headlights covers. My daughter didn'
column2: t like them as the face is looking angry. I however, love them. It gives the rally car some attitude.

column1: 6 bricks can be fitted with a sticker.
• The checkered flag (2 stickers, one on each side of the flag)
By the way, on the sticker sheet, each sticker is numbered, for example, 1, 2, 3 ... so builders know the sequence of the stickers.
And there is also a printed dashboard tile.
1 minifig, Airborne Spoilers printed, but different torso than 60019 Stunt Plane and 60027 Monster Truck Transporter,
For an adult, a plain simple built. Nothing out of the ordinary.

My daughter (4 years and 3 months) was very exacted. This was gonna be her first built. I picked out the parts and she followed the instructions, step by step. I had to help three times, the rest of the built was ace.
O yes, almost forgot, I put on the stickers on the bricks.
A nice looking rally car, type hatchback. Nice color scheme, good looking front of the car, with the lights and light hoods. The car is sponsored by '
column7: is only visible on the minifigs torso.

column1: I do not like the looks of the spoiler that much. It'
column2: s just not their yet, however it is adjustable, which is nice.

column1: What perhaps is missing, just a minor detail, is a start flag. We have a checkered flag for the finish line, but in the real rally cross, there is also a flag at the startline.
Value for money: Great. Hence it is a rally car, playability can be on road and off road.

,TRUE,4,4,5,5,5 Puffypolo","2023-01-29T15:59:57.76Z","6634 grandson","

Bought this one because it reminded me of 6634 Stock Car from 1986.
A very detailed car with great colour scheme.
The grill with headlights in the front really stands out in the crowd, making this a very sporty car.
